content.user_title: Look up current research and academic papers
content.value_statement: Need to find recent academic papers or verify scientific claims? This skill searches scholarly sources automatically and provides citations. It selects the best model based on query complexity to balance speed and depth.
actual_capabilities: Search academic papers and scholarly sources using Perplexity Sonar models
Automatically select fast Pro Search or deep Reasoning Pro based on query type
Extract and format citations with DOI links and source URLs
Prioritize high-impact journals and highly-cited papers in results
limitations: Requires OPENROUTER_API_KEY environment variable to be set
May not access full text behind paywalls
Information limited to publicly available scholarly sources

use_cases.title: Literature review assistance
use_cases.description: Find recent papers, verify citations, and gather evidence for manuscripts

use_cases.title: Fact-checking research claims
use_cases.description: Verify statistics, findings, and scientific statements against current literature

use_cases.title: Background research gathering
use_cases.description: Locate relevant sources for essays, presentations, and course materials

prompt_templates.title: Basic paper search
prompt_templates.scenario: Find recent papers on a topic
prompt_templates.prompt: Find recent academic papers on {topic} from 2023-2024 with citations

prompt_templates.title: Protocol lookup
prompt_templates.prompt: What is the standard protocol for {procedure} including key steps and considerations

prompt_templates.title: Systematic review
prompt_templates.prompt: Find landmark studies and meta-analyses on {topic} with citation counts and journal impact

output_examples.input: Recent advances in mRNA vaccine technology 2024
output: Research Summary: Recent advances in mRNA vaccine technology focus on improved delivery systems, thermostability, and novel applications beyond infectious diseases.
Key Papers: 5 papers prioritized by citation impact and venue prestige
Sources: Nature, The Lancet, NEJM with full citations and DOI links

best_practices: Use specific query terms including timeframe and type of information needed
Use reasoning keywords like 'compare' or 'explain' for complex analytical queries
Verify all citations against primary sources before citing in academic work
anti_patterns: Asking overly broad queries like 'Tell me about AI' instead of specific topics
Using research-lookup for non-academic sources like news or current events
Assuming all AI-generated citations are accurate without verification

faq.question: What models does this skill use?
faq.answer: It uses Perplexity Sonar Pro Search for fast lookups and Sonar Reasoning Pro for complex analysis. Selection is automatic.

faq.question: How do I set up the API key?
faq.answer: Set the OPENROUTER_API_KEY environment variable. Get your key from openrouter.ai and add it to your .env file.

faq.question: Does it access academic databases directly?
faq.answer: It accesses Perplexity's search capabilities which index academic sources. Full text behind paywalls may not be available.

faq.question: Can I force a specific model?
faq.answer: Yes, use force_model='pro' for fast searches or force_model='reasoning' for deep analysis when initializing the tool.

faq.question: How are citations formatted?
faq.answer: Citations include title, authors, journal, year, and DOI when available. URLs link to the original source.

faq.question: What types of sources are prioritized?
faq.answer: Peer-reviewed journals, high-impact venues like Nature and Science, and highly-cited papers are prioritized in results.
